Author: yorklab#7270
Content:
I have a surface 3 tablet and a desktop (Windows). In both machines the Agama SPV had not been able to connect to the SPV server for about a week now. When trying to switch servers in settings nothing seems to happen on the desktop, but the surface tablet will come up with a red box in the lower right hand corner saying ‚Äútcp is unreachable‚Äù. This may be unrelated but at about the same time Agama native on the desktop will reach about 98% then stall there. I tried 2.39 and 2.4 on both machines. The desktop has AVG (I did put in exceptions) and the Surface tablet only has what came with windows (no off the shelf anti-virus). I was unable to change the Socket Timeout and using the proxy did not help. as instructed here:

https://komodoplatform.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/KPSD/pages/353075201/How+to+solve+SPV+connectivity+issues+when+using+Agama+in+lite+SPV+mode

Author: Cranky#9935
Content:
I've added these to my wallet.conf file for Credits (no idea if these are required as not documented);

server=1
txindex=1
rpcbind=127.0.0.1

Restarted my Credits wallet and then BarterDEX but no change.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
you need 
```rpcuser=arandomuser
rpcpassword=arandompassword```
in there too, or marketmaker cannot speak to the native deamon.

Author: Cranky#9935
Content: Yes they are there by default

Author: Cranky#9935
Content:
Here is the whole file with user/pass changed
```
#Do not use special characters with username/password
rpcuser=notforyou
rpcpassword=notmypassword
rpcport=31050
port=31000
server=1
txindex=1
rpcbind=127.0.0.1
#gen=1
#genproclimit=1
maxconnections=10
#testnet=1
```

Author: Cranky#9935
Content: could be the maxconnections I guess, I'll comment it out

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: no

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: start barterdex, login

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: then exit it

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: then stop your deamon and start it with -rescan

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: the reluanch barterdex and login with the same seed.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: this will fix it

Content: üëç

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [matrix] <blackjok3r:matrix.org> yes, that happens is the marketmaker imports the address as watchonly, to your local wallet.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [matrix] <blackjok3r:matrix.org> without a rescan, so if you send funds to it, before barterdex is open i cannt see them.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [matrix] <blackjok3r:matrix.org> rescan will fix 99% of the time using native.

Content:
If you are using password, only the correct password will let you login. So if you are logging in using a password, that means you are logging into the same wallet address as you previously used. First login and copy the address  and search it here: https://kmd.explorer.supernet.org
You might see your balance
